segments.text: I see the boy on the stool, and I can’t believe how careless he’s being.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s stretching so far that the stool is about to tip over, and he doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think he’s just thinking about the cookies and nothing else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is standing there, waiting for him, like this is perfectly fine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t stand how reckless they’re being, especially with the water all over the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes, completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like someone needs to stop them before they get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, the water is spreading, and they’re just focused on cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how selfish they’re being, not even thinking about the mess they’re making.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish they would just stop and think about what they’re doing.
segments.speaker: PAR
